One of the many reasons that I switched from Windows 10, was because there was so much adware pre-installed, and it was a pain in the a** to uninstall. So, it is disappointing to see that Canonical have included this Amazon app with a fresh install of Ubuntu. The fact that this app is included with the OS gives the impression that they are trying to force people to use Amazon, just so they can make money. If this is what Canonical are going to do with Ubuntu, I'll have to think about switching to another Linux distribution. (there are plenty more out there!)

no la instalen no me deja desinstalar un asco

Abran un terminal o consola, y escriban "sudo apt remove sendmail-bin". El tal "sendmail-bin" parece ser el paquete que impida que se desinstale esta aplicación de Amazon. Presionen Enter, confirmen, y cuando eso termine podrán desinstalar la aplicación.
Recuerden hacer "sudo apt autoremove" para también quitar todas las dependencias que traía!
